description: From Middle English bleaunt, blehand, blihand, from Old Northern French bliaunt, probably of Germanic origin, from Frankish *bl朝fald, from *bl朝u + *faldan.
Compare Old French bliaut, blialt, Medieval Latin blialdus, Middle High German bl朝ant, bl朝alt. More at English bliaut.

entries.meaning: (historical) A short tunic or blouse worn in the Middle Ages
